intro: Cupania wadsworthii, commonly known as the Wadsworth's cupania, is a flowering plant species native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Cupania wadsworthii is often found in moist, disturbed soils in woodland edges and along streams.
